page.title: 01SUMMARY OF MOELFRE DISTRICT
page.content: Our area contains three villages. Moelfre, the largest has a population of 1,500 and is compact. Marianglas the middle size has the population of 300. Penrhoslligwy has a population of approx. 150. These two are widespread. The coastline is rocky with sandy beaches in the S.E. Moelfre is Welsh for "Bare area", and has very few trees. Marianglas which means "Green common" is built around common land. Penrhoslligwy, which means "The marsh above the river Lligwy",has a main road running through it. Many visitors stay in the district during summer. It is quiet in the winter. The rock found here is mainly lime-stone. Bodafon Mountain which over looks the district is granite.PETER WALKER.
